result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew Denton Schmidt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Escape while under Extended Supervision, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.42(2m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any AODA counseling/treatment per agent.  Participate and comply with and complete Sauk Co. Adult Drug Court, No contact with anyone that is affiliated with a gang.  ALL COURT ORDERED OBLIGATIONS TO BE PAID THROUGH CLERK OF COURTS WITHIN 60 DAYS OR SET UP PAYMENT ARRANGEMENTS.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

No contest plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court finds Defendant guilty. State makes statement.  Atty. Dolch makes statement.  DE makes alloquation. Court withholds sentence.

Defendant Matthew Denton Schmidt in court, in custody.  Atty Puck Tsai appears w/DE for today's hearing only at the request of the Court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense waives reading of complaint.  Court quashes warrant.  Atty Tsai doesn't know if DE will qualify for PD appt yet.  State requests quick hearing dates be set as she thinks it needs to be settled w/in 120 days.  Atty Tsai responds.  Advised rights to an attorney.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived.  $2,000.00 signature bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 10:15 am.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 10:45 am.
